summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 between a federal prosecutor and an attorney representing an individual who received a grand jury subpoena. The prosecutor outlines the information sought from the attorney's client, including flight records, observations of young women on flights, discussions with Jeffrey Epstein, and identities of Epstein's employees. The prosecutor offers to hold the subpoena return date in abeyance in anticipation of a proffer or interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein.' The email seeks information about his relationships with young women or girls, his related legal issues, and his employees.

events.title: Original subpoena return date
events.description: The original date by which the subpoenaed individual was to comply. The prosecutor offers to hold this date in abeyance.

keyFacts: A federal prosecutor is seeking flight manifests, plans, and travel records dating back to 2000 from a subpoenaed individual.
The prosecutor specifically seeks information about observations of young women or girls on flights and any discussions with Jeffrey Epstein about his relationships with young women or girls.
The prosecutor is also seeking the identities of Epstein's current and previous employees and staff.
The prosecutor indicates a willingness to hold the subpoena return date in abeyance in anticipation of receiving a proffer or conducting a voluntary interview.
